body_html:
Hello. I have tried to build the pytorch package using python setup.py install and also python setup.py build develop. Both versions of the command results in the same error.
I was using using the setup.py option to build the pytorch package. However when building caffe2 I usually use the cmake option. My question really was how to pass cmake flags when using python setup.py since now both packages are built together.

I was using using the setup.py option to build the pytorch package. However when building caffe2 I usually use the cmake option. My question really was how to pass cmake flags  when using python setup.py since now both packages are built together.
body:
Hello. I have tried  to build the pytorch package using `python setup.py install` and also  `python setup.py build develop`. Both versions of the command results in the same error.
I was using using the setup.py option to build the pytorch package. However when building caffe2 I usually use the cmake option. My question really was how to pass cmake flags  when using python setup.py since now both packages are built together.
